CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant ’s parents , by way of a donation contract , transferred to the applicant their ownership title to a garage .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was sued by her parents . They asked the ORG to order the applicant to return the above gift .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s request for an interim measure was dismissed on DATE .
CARDINAL . Several hearings took place DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found a violation of the applicant ’s right under LAW to a hearing without unjustified delay and her right under LAW to a hearing within a reasonable time . It held that the case was not complex and the applicant ’s conduct had not contributed to the length of the proceedings . The period of inactivity totalling DATE was imputable to ORG .

CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court awarded the applicant CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) ( the equivalent of CARDINAL at that time ) as just satisfaction in respect of non - pecuniary damage . It also ordered ORG to avoid any further delay in the proceedings and to reimburse the applicant ’s costs .
CARDINAL . A hearing took place on DATE . Another hearing , scheduled for DATE , was adjourned .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG dismissed the action . The judgment was served on the applicant on DATE and became final and enforceable on DATE .
